        public static java.util.ArrayList<PopularPlace> retrieveTopKPopularPlaces(int topK,
                                                                          java.lang.String startDateTime)
        returns a K number of popular places within the previous 15 minutes windows query of the date specified.
        Parameters:
        topK - the number of results user wants to see
        startDateTime - the start date and time of the query the user specified
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of rank results of the Top K Popular places
        See Also:
        PopularPlace

      • getUsersLocatedAt

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUsersLocatedAt(java.lang.String semanticPlace,
                                                                      java.lang.String atTime)
                                                               throws java.text.ParseException,
                                                                      java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                      java.lang.NullPointerException
        Gets all users located at a particular place during the specified time using previous 15 minutes window
        Parameters:
        semanticPlace - name of location
        atTime - specific time in query window
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of users at a particular location
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Signals that an error has been reached unexpectedly while parsing.
        java.sql.SQLException - An exception that provides information on a database access error or other errors
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An application attempts to use null in a case where an object is required

      • getLastVisitForUsers

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getLastVisitForUsers(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> macAddresses,
                                                                                        java.lang.String semanticPlace,
                                                                                        java.lang.String atTime)
                                                                                 throws java.text.ParseException,
                                                                                        java.sql.SQLException,
                                                                                        java.lang.NullPointerException
        Track each of these discovered users (i.e., located at the specified place) for the next 15 minutes to see if they visit another semantic place.

        To "visit a place", a user has to spend at least 5 minutes continously at that place. If a user visited multiple places for 5 minutes within the next 15 minutes, only the last semantic place will be returned and next place can be the same as the original semantic place (in the previous and next window)

        Parameters:
        macAddresses - mac address of user
        semanticPlace - name of location
        atTime - specified time in query window
        Returns:
        a HashMap of mac address that corresponds to the user's last visited location
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Signals that an error has been reached unexpectedly while parsing.
        java.sql.SQLException - An exception that provides information on a database access error or other errors
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An application attempts to use null in a case where an object is required

      • getTopKNextPlaces

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<TopKNextPlaceResult>> getTopKNextPlaces(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nextPlaces,
                                                                                                              int kValue)
                                                                                                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns top k rank of next places.

        rank will be sorted in descending order while places with a same rank will be sorted lexicographically

        Parameters:
        nextPlaces - a list of last-visited-place that each user visits within a specified time window
        kValue - an integer from 1 to 10 which displays the top k value when selected in the query window
        Returns:
        a HashMap of the top k next places that users are likely to visit after visiting a particular place
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - An application attempts to use null in a case where an object is required

      • retrieveAllStudents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> retrieveAllStudents()
        return all unique names of students in demographics database
        Returns:
        an arraylist contains all students' name

      • retrieveTopKCompanions

        public static java.util.ArrayList<CompanionTimeSpent> retrieveTopKCompanions(int topK,
                                                                             java.lang.String startDateTime,
                                                                             java.lang.String endDateTime,
                                                                             java.lang.String macAddr)
                                                                      throws java.text.ParseException
        Returns top-k other users who were co-located with a specified user (using MAC address) in a specified query window.Two users are considered to be co-located if their location updates have the same location id at any time during the specified query window.

        List of co-located users would be ranked based on the time spent together with the specified user. Multiple users with the same amount of co-located time would be assigned the same rank

        Parameters:
        topK - the number of results to display to the user
        startDateTime - the start time stamp of the user's query window
        endDateTime - the end time stamp of the user's query window
        macAddr - the mac address of the specified user to query
        Returns:
        ArrayList of objects containing companion and the time spent of this companion with the given mac address
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - the exception thrown when the user inputs an invalid date
